name: Bullet Hell Monday: Black
description:
"Bullet Hell Monday: Black": Dazzling Barrages, to the Ultimate Battlefield - The Fateful Monday, the Black Challenge Begins.

As the sequel to "Bullet Hell Monday," "Bullet Hell Monday: Black" offers an exciting experience for players seeking advanced skills and intricate strategies. With six ship types, each boasting unique shots and bombs, the battle comes to life. Furthermore, six special weapons have been added as a common system.

In "Bullet Hell Monday: Black," six special weapons (SP) expand the tactical possibilities for players. Each SP can be used and deployed tactically depending on the situation.


- Homing Laser: Automatically targets enemies with lasers that inflict damage.
- Blade: Delivers slashing attacks at close range, capable of cutting through bullet patterns.
- Spark: Powers up your ship.
- Decoy: Generates a virtual ship that distracts enemies.
- Time: Slows down the speed of enemies and bullet patterns.
- Barrier: Creates a barrier that neutralizes bullet patterns within its range.

The game features three playable modes: Black Mode, Original Mode, and Extra Mode. Black Mode offers high-difficulty arcade-style stages with four difficulty settings from EASY to HEAVEN. In Original Mode, you can enjoy the stages from the previous installment.

Extra Mode is a special mode where you challenge yourself with only one life, and the difficulty increases the longer you survive. Several stages with different rules are prepared, providing a tough challenge that doesn't end until your ship falls.

The game supports controllers, mouse+keyboard, and keyboard, allowing you to choose according to your preference. With online rankings, you can compete with players worldwide and hone your skills. Additionally, the local replay feature lets you review your own play. The game also supports vertical screen orientation, so you can enjoy immersive gameplay.

Put your skills and passion to the test in "Bullet Hell Monday: Black" and triumph over the ultimate challenge.
